intro: Onosma javorkae, commonly known as the Kashmir wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Pakistan and India. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
